H0.text: Odor receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

H1.text: Matter receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

H2.text: Consumption receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

H3.text: Optic receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

A4.text: Olfactory receptors (ORs) are located in both the cilia and synapses of the olfactory sensory neurons and in the epithelium of the human airway.

A5.text: Olfactory receptors (ORs) are chemoreceptors expressed in the cell membranes of olfactory receptor neurons and are responsible for the detection of odorants which give rise to the sense of smell.
